title: Box slides down a rough ramp

content.question: A box of mass <math alttext="0.50 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.50</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> slides down a rough ramp with an initial speed of <math alttext="2.0 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.0</mn><mtext> m/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. The ramp is inclined at an angle of <math alttext="30 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mo>Â°</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> above the horizontal. The box slides a distance of <math alttext="1.5 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mtext> m</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and comes to rest before reaching the bottom of the ramp. The energy dissipated as the box slides to a stop is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
